intro: Acerates tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly acerates, is a species of flowering plant characterized by its dense, soft, white pubescence covering its stems and leaves. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, and its flowers are typically small and clustered. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
